page.title: 06THE TILBURYS
page.content: { West Tilbury,Tilbury and East {Tilbury}are very different. West Tilbury dates from 600A.D.and is a quiet rural village. East Tilbury itself is old but the part concerned in our survey hinges around the {Bata}shoe factory and much of the housing was provided by Bata. Other people living there or in adjacent Linford mainly commute to the nearby towns or to London. Tilbury has been a{major dock}since{ {1881 }when her docks were built as an adjunct to London docks.Before that there were only marsh farms and scattered cottages.Self-sufficient villages are no longer required and nowadays people drive to ASDA(the local hypermarket on the outskirts of Tilbury) to do their shopping.
